IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: COVE'S EDGE, INC. WILL UPHOLD THE TRUST PLACED IN US BY ASSURING: - THE BEST AND MOST COMPASSIONATE SKILLED NURSING, LONG TERM-CARE, ASSISTED LIVING AND ADULT DAY CARE SERVICES FROM WELL TRAINED PROFESSIONALS. -THAT THE INDEPENDENCE AND DIGNITY OF OUR PATIENTS, RESIDENTS, AND CLIENTS WILL ALWAYS BE RESPECTED, -AND PROMOTING OPEN COMMUNICATION IN ALL CARE DECISIONS -THAT, AS A NOT-FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATION, WE WILL BE TRUSTWORTHY STEWARDS OF OUR RESOURCES. -OUR ACTIVE PARTICIPATION AND SUPPORT OF THE MAINEHEALTH FAMILY.
IRS990.MissionDescription: COVE'S EDGE, INC. WILL UPHOLD THE TRUST PLACED IN US BY ASSURING: - THE BEST AND MOST COMPASSIONATE SKILLED NURSING, LONG TERM-CARE, ASSISTED LIVING AND ADULT DAY CARE SERVICES FROM WELL TRAINED PROFESSIONALS. -THAT THE INDEPENDENCE AND DIGNITY OF OUR PATIENTS, RESIDENTS, AND CLIENTS WILL ALWAYS BE RESPECTED, -AND PROMOTING OPEN COMMUNICATION IN ALL CARE DECISIONS -THAT, AS A NOT-FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATION, WE WILL BE TRUSTWORTHY STEWARDS OF OUR RESOURCES. -OUR ACTIVE PARTICIPATION AND SUPPORT OF THE MAINEHEALTH FAMILY.
IRS990.Description: LONG TERM CARE - COVE'S EDGE, INC. LONG TERM CARE PROGRAM SERVICES INCLUDE A 76 BED, DUALLY LICENSED FACILITY THAT PROVIDES BOTH SKILLED AND LONG TERM NURSING CARE TO ITS RESIDENTS. FOR THE YEAR ENDED SEPTEMBER 30, 2010, COVE'S EDGE HAD 26,729 PATIENT DAYS. OF THOSE DAYS, 21% REPRESENTED MEDICARE PATIENTS AND 54% MAINECARE. SEE ATTACHED COMMUNITY BENEFIT STATEMENT.

Activity2.Description: RESIDENTIAL CARE - COVE'S EDGE, INC. PROVIDES RESIDENTIAL CARE AT ITS CHASE POINT FACILITY. CHASE POINT CONSISTS OF 24 RESIDENTIAL CARE APARTMENTS AND 18 DEMENTIA CARE BEDS. FOR THE YEAR ENDED SEPTEMBER 30, 2010, CHASE POINT HAD 7,926 RESIDENTIAL CARE PATIENT DAYS AND 6,300 DEMENTIA CARE PATIENT DAYS. OF THE DEMENTIA CARE DAYS, 42% REPRESENTED MAINECARE PATIENTS.

Activity3.Description: HOME HEALTH - COVE'S EDGE, INC. PROVIDES HOME HEALTH SERVICES UNDER ITS DBA MILES HOME HEALTH & HOSPICE. SERVICES DURING THE YEAR ENDING SEPTEMBER 30, 2010, INCLUDED 12,548 PROFESSIONAL VISITS (82% MEDICARE), 7,638 PRIVATE DUTY VISITS, 5,137 HOSPICE CARE DAYS, AND 3,325 LIFELINE MONTHLY SUBSCRIBERS.

Form990ScheduleCPartIV.Explanation: 35.53% OR 1,970 OF MEMBER DUES PAID TO MAINE HEALTH CARE ASSOCIATION (MHCA) IS ALLOCATED TO LOBBYING ACTIVITIES. 35.53% OR 556 OF MEMBER DUES PAID TO AMERICAN HEALTH CARE ASSOCIATION (AHCA) IS ALLOCATED TO LOBBYING ACTIVITIES. 2.62% OR 201 OF MEMBER DUES PAID TO HOME CARE & HOSPICE ALLIANCE OF MAINE IS ALLOCATED TO LOBBYING ACTIVITIES.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: BOARD DESIGNATED FUNDS - COVES CARE AND THE MCLAUGHLIN FUND: -INTEREST EARNED ON THE COVES CARE FUND IS EARMARKED SPECIFICALLY FOR EDUCATION FOR STAFF IN LONG TERM CARE OR ASSISTED LIVING; AND -INTERST EARNED ON THE MCLAUGHLIN FUND IS EARMARKED FOR THE COURTYARD UPKEEP. PERMANENT ENDOWMENT - HOSPICE FUND -3% OF THE MARKET VALUE OF THE FUND IS USED FOR MISCELLANEOUS HOSPICE NEEDS AS APPROVED BY THE BOARD.

GeneralExplanation.Explanation: COVE'S EDGE, INC. WILL UPHOLD THE TRUST PLACED IN US BY ASSURING: - THE BEST AND MOST COMPASSIONATE SKILLED NURSING, LONG TERM-CARE, ASSISTED LIVING AND ADULT DAY CARE SERVICES FROM WELL TRAINED PROFESSIONALS. -THAT THE INDEPENDENCE AND DIGNITY OF OUR PATIENTS, RESIDENTS, AND CLIENTS WILL ALWAYS BE RESPECTED, -AND PROMOTING OPEN COMMUNICATION IN ALL CARE DECISIONS -THAT, AS A NOT-FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATION, WE WILL BE TRUSTWORTHY STEWARDS OF OUR RESOURCES. -OUR ACTIVE PARTICIPATION AND SUPPORT OF THE MAINEHEALTH FAMILY.

LINCOLN COUNTY HEALTH CARE, INC. (EIN 26-1475629) IS THE SOLE MEMBER OF COVE'S EDGE, INC. MAINEHEALTH (EIN 01-0431680), AS THE SOLE MEMBER OF LCHC HAS THE RIGHT TO APPROVE SIGNIFICANT DECISIONS OF THE GOVERNING BOARD OF COVE'S EDGE.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: ELECTION OF MEMBERS AND THEIR RIGHTS
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE MEMBER ELECTS THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. ALL OFFICERS OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES ARE ELECTED BY THE BOARD, AND EACH MUST BE A TRUSTEE. OFFICERS OF THE CORPORATION ARE ELECTED ANNUALLY BY THE BOARD.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: DECISIONS SUBJECT TO APPROVAL OF MEMBERS
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: DECISIONS OF THE GOVERNING BODY SUCH AS BUDGETS, BUSINESS STRATEGIES, SIGNIFICANT FINANCIAL COMMITMENTS, AMENDMENTS TO THE ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION, AND ELECTION OF THE CEO AMONG OTHER DECISIONS, ARE SUBJECT TO APPROVAL BY LINCOLN COUNTY HEALTH CARE, INC. AND MAINEHEALTH.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: ORGANIZATION'S PROCESS USED TO REVIEW FORM 990
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: EDUCATION WAS PROVIDED TO THE FINANCE COMMITTEE CONCERNING THE REVISED IRS FORM 990. THE FINANCE COMMITTEE PERFORMS A DETAILED REVIEW OF THE FORM 990. THE FORM 990 IS THEN MADE AVAILABLE TO THE FULL BOARD. THE CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER ALSO PERFORMS A DETAILED REVIEW OF THE ENTIRE FORM 990 BEFORE SIGNING AND PRIOR TO FILING.

ANY DUALITY OF INTEREST OR POSSIBLE CONFLICT OF INTEREST ON THE PART OF A TRUSTEE, PHYSICIAN, OFFICER OR MANAGER (E.G., A MEMBER OF LINCOLN COUNTY HEALTHCARE LEADERSHIP TEAM, DIRECTOR, MANAGER OR PERSON RESPONSIBLE FOR PURCHASING) MUST BE DISCLOSED TO THE APPLICABLE BOARD, BOARD COMMITTEE OR, IN THE CASE OF AN ADMINISTRATIVE DECISION THAT IS NOT SUBJECT TO BOARD OR COMMITTEE APPROVAL, TO THE MANAGER'S IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. SUCH DISCLOSURES SHALL BE MADE A MATTER OF RECORD. DISCLOSURE WILL BE MADE AT THE TIME OF INITIAL AFFILIATION WITH LINCOLN COUNTY HEALTHCARE ANNUALLY AND WHEN THE INTEREST BECOMES A MATTER FOR BOARD OR COMMITTEE ACTION OR ADMINISTRATIVE DECISION. DISCLOSURE FORMS SHALL BE COMPLETED ANNUALLY BY TRUSTEES AND OFFICERS AT THE TIME OF THE ANNUAL MEETING, AND ANNUALLY BY VICE PRESIDENTS, DIRECTORS, AND MANAGERS IN CONJUNCTION WITH THEIR ANNUAL PERFORMANCE REVIEW.

IN CONSULTATION WITH TOWERS PERRIN, THE MAINEHEALTH EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE ESTABLISHES APPROPRIATE COMPENSATION PARAMETERS FOR EACH MEMBER ORGANIZATION'S CEO AND CERTAIN MEMBERS OF THEIR SENIOR MANAGEMENT TEAM. WORKING WITHIN THOSE PARAMETERS, THE LCHC COMPENSATION COMMITTEE DETERMINES THE LEVEL OF COMPENSATION FOR ITS CEO. THE FINDINGS OF THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE ARE MADE TRANSPARENT TO, AND VOTED ON BY, THE FULL GOVERNING BOARD. THIS "TOTAL EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION" IS FILED PUBLICLY BY THE ORGANIZATION, AND INCLUDES "TOTAL CASH COMPENSATION" AND "TOTAL VALUE OF ALL BENEFITS AND PERQUISITES ASSOCIATED WITH POSITION (SUCH AS HOUSING ALLOWANCES, SOCIAL CLUB MEMBERSHIPS, SIGNING BONUSES, ETC.)". THE BOARD TAKES NECESSARY ACTION TO PREVENT THE CEO FROM VOTING OR DIRECTLY PARTICIPATING IN THE FINAL COMMITTEE DETERMINATION OF (HER/HIS) OWN COMPENSATION. THE ORGANIZATION'S EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION PROCEDURE RELIES UPON APPROPRIATE DATA FOR COMPARABILITY (E.G. COMPENSATION LEVELS PAID BY BOTH TAXABLE AND TAX-EXEMPT SIMILARLY SITUATED ORGANIZATIONS AND INDEPENDENT COMPENSATION SURVEYS BY NATIONALLY RECOGNIZED INDEPENDENT FIRMS). FINALLY, THE ORGANIZATION REFRAINS FROM ALLOWING EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION TO EVER BE BASED SOLELY ON LCHC'S REVENUES OR OTHER SIMILAR PROFIT-SHARING STRATEGIES.

THE BOARD TAKES NECESSARY ACTION TO PREVENT THE CEO FROM VOTING OR DIRECTLY PARTICIPATING IN THE FINAL COMMITTEE DETERMINATION OF (HER/HIS) OWN COMPENSATION. COMPENSATION LEVELS PAID BY BOTH TAXABLE AND TAX-EXEMPT SIMILARLY SITUATED ORGANIZATIONS AND INDEPENDENT COMPENSATION SURVEYS BY NATIONALLY RECOGNIZED INDEPENDENT FIRMS). FINALLY, THE ORGANIZATION REFRAINS FROM ALLOWING EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION TO EVER BE BASED SOLELY ON LCHC'S REVENUES OR OTHER SIMILAR PROFIT-SHARING STRATEGIES.
DOCUMENTS THAT ARE REQUIRED TO BE OPEN FOR PUBLIC INSPECTION ARE MADE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.

FORM 990, PART XI, LINE 2A, FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND REPORTING THE FINANCIAL RESULTS OF THE ORGANIZATION WERE PART OF A CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENT AUDIT PREPARED FOR LINCOLN COUNTY HEALTH CARE, INC. (EIN 26-1475629) AND ITS SUBSIDIARIES. SCHEDULE R, PART II: LINCOLN COUNTY MEDICAL GROUP (EIN 26-3878235) HAS APPLIED FOR PUBLIC CHARITY TAX-EXEMPT STATUS WITHIN THE DUE DATE REQUIRED TO RECEIVE IRS APPROVAL RETROACTIVE TO THE LEGAL DATE OF FORMATION.
